line_1: To grace my Sister, Friend, and Valentine!
line_2: From thy huge Wreath one little Chaplet twine,

line_1: Round the pink'd rims of crisped Valentine.
line_2: Letters, long proofs of love, and verses fine

line_1: The maid who wrote this Valentine.
Nor read in vain my Valentine.
line_2: Within thy breast to equal mine,

line_1: I'll bless the day of Valentine.
line_2: Then be thy softer wishes mine,

line_1: For her I mean to hail my Valentine,
line_2: Ere these my rustic hands a garland twine,
And thou, blest saint, whom choral creatures join

line_1: But wake, and be my faithful Valentine.
line_2: Which in fresh chaplets joyful I will twine;
